title: Combining Attitudinals and Evidentials
goal: Practice using attitudinals and evidentials together.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Evidential review:

I observe → ?
I heard → ?
In my opinion → ?
Certainly → ?

(Answers: za'a, ti'e, pe'i, ju'o)

New Material (5-7 min)

Combining Both Types

You can use attitudinals AND evidentials together:

.ui za'a do klama

(Happy!) I observe you going.

ti'e .uu la .tam. cu bilma

I heard (pity!) Tom is sick.

Order

Either order works, but typically:

  • Attitudinal first expresses your reaction
  • Evidential first emphasizes the source
.ui ti'e la .bob. cu snada

(Happy!) I heard Bob succeeded.

ti'e .ui la .bob. cu snada

I heard (happy!) Bob succeeded.

Complex Examples

.a'o pe'i do snada

I hope, in my opinion, you succeed.

ju'o .ie ti jetnu

Certainly (I agree) this is true.

za'a .uu lo gerku cu bilma

I observe (pity) the dog is sick.

Key Point

Combine attitudinals (feelings) with evidentials (knowledge source) for nuanced expression.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Combine

Add both attitudinal and evidential:

  1. I observe (happy) you succeeded. → ?
  2. I heard (pity) Bob is sick. → ?
  3. Certainly (I agree) this is true. → ?
Answers
  1. za'a .ui do snada
  2. ti'e .uu la .bob. cu bilma
  3. ju'o .ie ti jetnu

Exercise 2: Interpret

What does each mean?

  1. .ui ti'e do snada
  2. pe'i .ie ti xamgu
  3. za'a .oi lo gerku cu bilma
Answers
  1. (Happy!) I heard you succeeded.
  2. In my opinion (I agree), this is good.
  3. I observe (pain/pity) the dog is sick.

Exercise 3: React to News

React with combined attitudinal + evidential:

  1. You hear good news about Alice. → ?
  2. You observe something sad. → ?
  3. You're certain about something hopeful. → ?
Answers
  1. ti'e .ui la .alis. cu snada (I heard, happy! Alice succeeded)
  2. za'a .uu ti (I observe, pity, this)
  3. ju'o .a'o ti xamgu (Certainly, hope, this is good)

items.answer: In my opinion (I agree), this is good.
I observe (pain/pity) the dog is sick.

items.text: You hear good news about Alice. → ?
items.answer: `ti'e .ui la .alis. cu snada` (I heard, happy! Alice succeeded)
`ju'o .a'o ti xamgu` (Certainly, hope, this is good)

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "Happy! I heard you succeeded." → .ui ti'e do snada
  2. "I observe (pity) the dog is sick." → za'a .uu lo gerku cu bilma
  3. "Certainly, I agree." → ju'o .ie

Today's Review

Combination patterns:

Pattern Meaning
.ui ti'e X Happy about heard info
za'a .uu X Observing with pity
ju'o .ie X Certain and agreeing
pe'i .a'o X Opining hopefully

Summary

You practiced combining attitudinals (feelings) with evidentials (knowledge sources) for rich emotional and epistemic expression.
